name: GigList
slogan: The world's what's-on guide for music
description: GigList brings together the world's music events into a single, easy-to-use dashboard for users to search. Reducing the need for multiple platform searches, and disrupting the dominance of ticket sale only platforms, GigList is built by music lovers for music lovers who want to see which events are taking place.

team.title: CEO and Founder
team.name: James Eddleston
team.bioHtml: CEO and Founder @GigList Software and tech geek. Music lover.

jobs.title: Music writers and contributors
jobs.description:
GigList is a market-disruptive music events and magazine site that launched in 2017. We’re pushing the boundaries of what music media and event listings can achieve.

Powered by an ambitious and successful team, we’re looking to add hungry young things who love music and love to write about it to come on board. Getting involved at this stage can put you in the front row when it comes to your future career in music and media.

We’re looking for voluntary writers based anywhere in the country – particularly around London, Manchester, Brighton, Liverpool, Leeds and Glasgow.

You won’t necessarily need prior experience, just a hunger to learn and write about music and events, and ideas on what you can contribute. There will be access to free gigs, interviews with artists and other cool stuff. If you’re looking to get started in music journalism and media, this is the ideal role for you to gain exposure and hone your craft.

Send us your CV via the link below with  any samples you have and our editorial team will get back to you really soon. 

Applications will only be consider by applying [here.](https://giglist.freshteam.com/jobs/eUWQJcOofa66/music-writers-and-live-contributors)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
GigList is a market-disruptive music events and magazine site that launched in 2017. We’re pushing the boundaries of what music media and event listings can achieve.

Powered by an ambitious and successful team, we’re looking to add hungry young things who love music and love to write about it to come on board. Getting involved at this stage can put you in the front row when it comes to your future career in music and media.

We’re looking for voluntary writers based anywhere in the country – particularly around London, Manchester, Brighton, Liverpool, Leeds and Glasgow.

You won’t necessarily need prior experience, just a hunger to learn and write about music and events, and ideas on what you can contribute. There will be access to free gigs, interviews with artists and other cool stuff. If you’re looking to get started in music journalism and media, this is the ideal role for you to gain exposure and hone your craft.

Send us your CV via the link below with any samples you have and our editorial team will get back to you really soon.

Applications will only be consider by applying here.
